 When 'god' is written, it is referring to any god of any religion (no capital letter = no name)

Actually capitalization of God generally takes place with any monotheistic diety, or possibly even just when referring to a specific one (i.e. the God and Goddess of Wicca)

If God is the name of the deity or part of the name then it is capitalized because all names are capitalized. If god is not the name, then it is not capitalized because it refers only to a deity, not to a specific one.
